titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 954) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt from the individual mandate certain individuals who had coverage under a terminated qualified health plan funded through the Consumer Operated and Oriented Plan (CO-OP) program.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 954) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt from the individual mandate certain individuals who had coverage under a terminated qualified health plan funded through the Consumer Operated and Oriented Plan (CO-OP) program.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-791, by Mr. Burgess.
The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 151.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 893.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 176 (Roll no. 559).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 177 (Roll no. 560).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 954) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt from the individual mandate certain individuals who had coverage under a terminated qualified health plan funded through the Consumer Operated and Oriented Plan (CO-OP) program.
